title: [Large-Scale] Accessibility Design Strategies for Mobile-Friendly Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of elementary and secondary mathematics fundamentals
context.additional_context: Implementing accessibility design accommodating diverse learner needs in smartphone-based learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners can access and utilize mobile-optimized math content (images, formulas, videos) with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners complete 90% or more of weekly microlearning modules designed according to Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Learners participate 100% in formative assessments using assistive technology-compatible evaluation tools (e.g., screen readers, high-contrast mode).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
